definition[0]: to be formed from a number of substances, parts, or people
example[0]: Water is composed of hydrogen and oxygen.
example[1]: The legal system is composed of people, and people make mistakes.
definition[1]: to combine together to form something
example[2]: More than 17.6 million firms compose the business sector of our economy.
definition[2]: to write a piece of music
example[3]: Barrington has composed the music for a new production of ‘A Midsummer Night’s Dream’.
definition[3]: to try hard to become calm after feeling very angry, upset, or excited
example[4]: Lynn took several deep breaths to compose herself.
definition[4]: to make yourself look or feel calm
example[5]: When asked a question, give yourself a second to compose your thoughts.
definition[5]: to arrange the parts of a painting, photograph, or scene in a way that achieves a particular result
example[6]: I like the way he composes his photographs.
